intro: Plagiobothrys lithocaryus, commonly known as the California rock-rose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. Plagiobothrys lithocaryus is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats.
